definition[0]: to make a place or substance dirty or harmful by putting something such as chemicals or poison in it
example[0]: Drinking water supplies are believed to have been contaminated.
definition[1]: to influence something in a way that has a bad effect
example[1]: He claims the poster ads have ‘contaminated Berlin’s streets’.
definition[2]: to make something dirty and dangerous, for example with chemicals or poison
example[2]: A large number of eggs were contaminated with salmonella.
definition[3]: to spoil goods carried by a ship, especially by sea water getting into them
